examples: the threat of a turned ankle was something they cared nothing about

adjective.description: (of earth) plowed or dug, so as to bring the underparts to the surface.
examples: the smell of turned earth and burning leaves

adjective.description: (of a wooden object) shaped on a lathe.
examples: a small table with turned legs made from poplar

adjective.description: (of a phrase or verse) expressed in a specified manner.
examples: the carefully turned words of great writers

adjective.description: (of a type or letter) printed or set upside down.
examples: a possible turned letter in cunning/cunuing
